Articles.Content:
Right.

trying to install the ENB Blueharvest addon, and it says I need the "KSP_win folder".

What one earth is this? I have KSP on steam BTW.

I have no idea what it's referring to.

Right click on the kerbal space program entry in your steam library, click on 'properties', and then in the 'local files' tab click on 'browse local files'. That should open the right folder for you.

The Squad store version installation folder is called 'KSP_win'.

In the Steam version, that same folder is called 'Kerbal Space Program' by default.

Edited November 10, 2013 by Awaras

Right click on the kerbal space program entry in your steam library, click on 'properties', and then in the 'local files' tab click on 'browse local files'. That should open the right folder for you.

The Squad store version creates a folder called 'KSP_win'.

In the Steam version, that same folder is called 'Kerbal Space Program' by default.

Well, I'm a gibbon.

Thanks for the help.
Actually i added loads of mods, but i can't find the KSP_win. I know it is at Program(86) / Steam / SteamApps / common / Kerbal Space Program, but there is no KSP_win. where is it?

Holy Necropost, Batman!

You might want to read the post a couple up from yours. KSP_Win is the location where KSP is installed if you download the Windows version from Squad's store page. Steam installs it to SteamApps/Common/Kerbal Space Program instead. Mods tend to install into the GameData directory inside common/Kerbal Space Program.

Hope that helps. Locking this thread before it gets the chance to drag its undead body any further across the forums. In future, please make a new thread rather than dragging up zombies from three years ago. Thanks!
